alert.note: Alert for Chittenden; Lamoille; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 19 at 3:05PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Vermont and northwest Vermont, including the following counties, in central Vermont, Washington. In northwest Vermont, Chittenden and Lamoille. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 305 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Barre, Montpelier, Middlesex, Worcester, Moretown, Waterbury Village, Berlin, Waterbury, East Montpelier, E F Knapp State Airport, Calais, Barre City, Stowe, Duxbury, Barre Town, Plainfield, Woodbury, Bolton, Marshfield and Huntington. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
